5VYR_jDeN8r5friT79p-Ig.text: Ordered the Sirloin that is marinated 48hrs in garlic, parsley and oil.  I chose a peppercorn mushroom dipping sauce.  I asked for medium rare and that was how it came, nice and pink on the inside while outside is caramelized.    Probably the best meal I had since being in London.

qidnsFry0NdfTB7KS0aDYA.text: "A place to be seen. Reasonable food that's a bit over-priced. It all feels a bit cynical & over-sold."I eat at more restaurants than are good for my bank balance, well at least enough to know what to expect for seventy quid a head (incl tip, wine, etc.) in this part of the world and Gaucho's  falls short. At fifty quid I would have been satisfied and rated this 'A-OK' (three stars) but without a change in ambience never more than that.- While the quality of the ingredients was good, it's over priced (even for Richmond).- I liked the wine selection but as a bit of a Malbec aficionado felt the sommelier was pushing more expensive wines over the best value choices.- We booked a table with a view and walked right past two empty ones on our way to a dark corner right at the back, being told there were none available despite booking a few weeks ahead. Of course, by the time the manager came over to explain the previously empty tables were filled by other people.- Staff have attitude, with the kind of the over confidence of extremely good looking young people who really shouldn't be working in a service job.I think I'd like this restaurant more 10 years ago when I was in my twenties and booked restaurants as much to be seen as to be fed. The food is good but for me the ambience undermined the overall experience.This is part of a chain and I'm told the Gauchos in town have the same good food plus a much improved ambience. If you're looking for a special evening out it you might have a better time heading towards Piccadilly .I have to say, many of the younger diners seemed to be having a great time. We, on the other hand, will be checking out many of the other really good restaurants London boasts instead.

spoCziSPgylI0IDA_ww18Q.text: I've lived in Twickenham and Richmond my entire live and this is, by a long shot, the best restaurant. It's perfectly located on the Thames riverside with a view of Richmond Bridge a short stroll away and the food and atmosphere is excellent.It's a steak house so expect steak. If this isn't your thing then you've come to the wrong place. However, there is an excellent Salmon dish that's worth a go. They've got a range of very tasty sides and the meat selection is varied. In fact, the selection process is something in itself, they bring all their cuts out on a big chopping board and describe each of their pros and cons.I don't drink wine but the waiter suggested a red that he thought would compliment our meals which I fell in love with and have every time I go back.Like others that have reviewed it, I use this restaurant for special occasions. It's classy, the food's great (really great), scenery is good, service is excellent, and once your belly is full they'll even drive you along the towpath to Richmond bridge in their golf buggy.You'll need to brace yourself for the bill though, because it'll be big. And you can't save dosh by avoiding service charge because the service is great, you'll probably even feel like tipping more than you usually would. Despite the size of the bill, it's worth it for a special occasion and you come away from it feeling that you got value. You might even feel like you owe them a 5 star review on Yelp.

2JZi1zckzBMMigAJbtpFpQ.text: Absolutely adore this place. Gaucho Richmond is by far the best Gaucho around. Far enough out of the town you get a lovely secluded atmosphere. If you don't want to walk the toe path along the river they can arrange for a golf buggy to pick you up from outside the slug and lettuce and drop you back after. Food is immense every time i have been and can't wait for a hot summer evening to go again. Book in advance or risk ending up at a chip shop

QhpskTkSTDNsdViyqJNGrA.text: Part of the Gaucho's chain, which I believe is the same as the ones in Amsterdam. Great selection of steak cuts and very good sides as well. Great wine selection, and I remember the cocktails being quite good too. The setting is on the bank of the Thames, so if you're looking to impress and are not shy to give the credit card a bit of a pasting, this is definitely a stylish venue to go to. Also a few steps away from B@1 for those post dinner drinks.

h-Phnf1akdtUBJD8bfLmPw.text: Was taken here to the Richmond Gaucho for Valentines day.Staff are lovely and friendly.The steak melts I your mouth.  Great selection of winesPlus had a  great view of the river

X68uYkNe8lktWJpdLrnnkA.text: As a South African that loves his meat this is as close to home as it gets .. Always make a reservation as it's a popular place. Sides are not included so make sure you bring lots of money. I will say this it's worth every penny ..

ArEkl_P8zd0s4g2lvbCQ8Q.text: I was here beginning of Jan fancying a nice piece of meat. I totally enjoyed the whole setting and the friendlyness of the staff. Food presentation was great and the meat nice and tender cooked to the point i requested. Unfortunately the potato mash was powder base which i didnt like at all. A restaurant in this league should be able to make it themselves. All in all it was a very enjoyable evening!

cI33Q0bLyDw_D6V_cY5zHQ.text: Had a really enjoyable time here. I love a good steak and this place does them soooo well. You can choose from all manner of cuts, and as with all good steak restaurants you get to see the cuts first. You can also choose weight - they even go up to 1kg, but 300g is more than enough! I had the fillet, rare, and it was extroardinary - melt in the mouth gorgeous. My wife had the marinaded sirloin and that was delicious too. The restaurant is kitted out like a nightclub - all black surfaces, funky furniture, moody lighting and pumping music. I'm sure the last Gaucho Grill I went to was more like a wild west cantina!! Anyway, they do a good line in Ceviche (marindaded raw fish) too plus if steak's not your thing there's plenty of other things on the menu. It seems to average out at around £40/head upwards, so not a destination for the casual diner. Its also tucked away on its own on the banks of the Thames with no direct car access. Beware the walk through the dimly lit & steeply inclined gardens!!

qdoM_fUTXW60OgVURk3tpA.text: This restaurant is great. It is overlooking the Richmond Riverside. It is spacious inside and has a sophisticated bar to sit at whilst you wait to for your friends or just to sit at.It is a dark atmosphere with star type lights in the ceiling.The food is minimal but very tasty and well cooked. You can choose your steaks and the size and how you want it cooked. I chose a chorizo steak and it was very tasty. You have to order vegs on the side and as extra. If you are expecting a big meal, this is not the place for you.I was impressed the way the brought the meats out on display to your table and showed you them, so you can choose.Expect this to be pricey, but you certainly get value for money, with the food, view and service.

FZeywGy0iCG9QNutJX1dDg.text: I haven't been here for a while, in fact, not since just after it opened around 3 years ago, but I think the prices have only moved north since then! Still, the place does exude class, and the meat is really to die for, but, you still want to make sure somebody else is paying. In the summer, what could be better than to walk off the accumulated calories than a stroll down Richmond riverside? Few things, indeed.

SygHVQ1PH26hDNv4peqGiQ.text: they forgot my drink 3x  (out of 5, so kinda bad)the cheese bread was good. the fries (sweet potato and regular potato) were soggy.we ordered the 4 steak sampler RARE and only 1 was actually...rare; others were medium even some medium-well; it's like they forgot the meat keeps on cooking off the grill. not good for a steak house to screw that up. sirloin was the best hands down.

MyUb_yMimK9ZQAo3kEi3JA.text: Can't really fault anything about this restaurant apart from the price. Meal for 2 £120. Service is great food cooked well, nice wine fantastic setting and yet for me it doesn't add up to the sum of its parts. Leaves me a little confused because as I say I can't fault anything and would go back but just not for a while.

XdwrbEKopLIyplBUNoRKsg.text: This is a great restaurant. The food is great, the service is excellent, the bill is quite large but well worth it for a special night out.

EXl8lA2Zr6Pg-zi3somX1Q.text: For all you steak lovers out there, you have to come to Gaucho. Argentinian steaks have never tasted better. Everything about the restaurant is wonderful, from the decor to the service. The steaks are cooked to perfection and of course to your chosing and the cost is incredibly reasonable! Fora meal for two with a decent bottle of wine we paid approximately £90. This included starters, mains + sides and coffee. Recommend the steaks which have been hung and marinated for a period of time. Good place for a business dinner, any form of celebration and most certainly dates!

AA6Q8C8cmIjYh_X04qO4lQ.text: What a fabulous night out in London! We'd never been to an Argentinian steak house but have dear friends who rave about Argentinian meat. They were right! My husband and I both felt we had the best steak we'd ever eaten. Go for the 400g filet steak. You won't be disappointed. And the sweet potato chips were the perfect accompaniment. We had the ice cream with whisky and walnuts and the dulce de leche cheesecake and both were very good. Look for a bottle of wine that will suit your taste. We also had the best wine that evening that we have ever had. We'll be going back!

GeAUtuEgN0BFxe3D6Tbr4g.text: Have been there only once: trendy, noisy, good food. I would recommend to go there in Summer and be on the terrace along the river. Not sure the prices are justified anyway

4jCIdp3k5vJcZeSCmPt26w.text: The best Fillet steak, come to think of it the best beef in the world and it is Argentinian. This is a must go to restaurant, problem is you will keep on going!

gehBhRJwLlzF0NcOCbNe7A.text: Hello, I had a great evening here and it was just as previous people had said. The service was excellent, the food and wine were great. Lovely views over the river. It will be great to go back again but in the summer so we can sit outside. Would highly recommend.

qFRVoJo4Q4gQFPs_q2X-fA.text: Great place if you want a reasonably priced meal. High quality meats presented to you and the cuts explained for those who are admittedly novices when it comes to choosing from the variety of weights and cuts. Good wine list, service fantastic for lunch and summer evenings by the river, will certainly be returning.

UIuf2JXA7IEcb8DpNVD9Wg.text: The Richmond Gaucho is the best Gaucho, in my opinion. We only go after nightfall. This time of year it is usually packed since they have a huge deck right by the Thames. I'd recommend getting reservations. That being said we have never had reservations (we eat out a lot and always go spur of the moment) and have always been able to get seated within twenty minutes time - just long enough to enjoy a glass of wine from their excellent wine list. They start you with a delicious basket of varied breads - my favorite roll is the one made with yucca flour. Dipped in a chimichurri so fresh and delicious that it makes your mouth water just thinking about it. The first time we went to Gaucho, my husband complimented the chimichurri to the waiter so eloquently that the waiter went to the kitchen to ask the chef to write down the recipe for us. As busy as it was - that was a nice surprise. And how optimistic of my husband to think we might actually eat in someday and resort to using the recipe rather than just walking down to Gaucho! So naive and optimisitic it's just adorable. I cannot say enough about their charrasco chorizo and garlicy spinach. It is wonderful. Not the priciest piece of beef on the menu but certainly my favorite. My husband usually gets a fish dish and is pleased. He hates fancy high priced restaurants and definitely had a mug on his face when I said I wanted to go to Gaucho to celebrate the night we moved here to Richmond. Now he is happy to go here with me despite it definitely being on the pricier side.

7ZAKA3r3f7oAxB5nrvARow.text: What a disappointment. My husband and I love Gaucho and frequent the branch at The O2, where we eat before concerts and events. When a friend wanted to meet somewhere in Richmond for lunch, I thought Gaucho would be the perfect spot. It's in a gorgeous location, and we were at on the deck. It soon became apparent that although the deck was full of patrons, most of them were unhappy by the amount of sun beating down on them. The restaurant should definitely invest in some sun umbrellas! People were constantly moving their chairs, relocating their tables, and holding their hands up to shade their eyes. It didn't make for a great ambiance.My friend was running late, so I ordered a bloody mary as a rare lunchtime treat. It was very tasty, but had strange hunks of basil in it, that kept clogging up the straw. And... why were they in there? When the waitress took our order, she immediately pointed out that the one dish I wanted (which contained crab) was not available. So, my friend and I both said we would have the burger (£15.95). The waitress said that we must be aware that Gaucho only cooks burgers one way: Well Done. What? Is this not a steakhouse that deals in RAW MEAT every day? If they are that worried about health and safety, should we avoid the steaks as well? OK so I said fine, and we ordered the burgers (against my better judgement). When they arrived, they were, as expected, completely WELL DONE and therefore, like eating burned rubber. The bun was so fluffy that it flaked away, sending an errant piece of fluff down my throat and me into a choking spasm. We both finally gave up on the useless bun and ate the burger alone with knife and fork. For some reason, although my dining companion is a rugby-shaped guy who's 6'2", the waitress continuously ignored his requests. It actually became a joke - he decided he must be wearing his Cloak of Invisibility. What?So, all in all, it was a fairly standard meal, executed poorly, with pretty terrible service. And a revolting bloody mary.

BesOowJSAtAQ41-scKUO_Q.text: EDIT TO BELOW REVIEW:To the restaurants credit, the manager apologised profusely, made no excuses and fully took responsibility, and provided the meal at no charge. He has asked that we consider coming back in future. I very much doubt that many restaurants would go to this length, so will give them another go based on his professionalism. We had the fish, so next time I'll try the beef. (I also upgraded from 1 to 3 stars - but we'll see how it goes next time).---------This will be a very short review.When you charge prices like this, I don't expect the world's most amazing meal, but I expect that at least the chef is skilled enough to cook food properly.Under cooking food is unacceptable, and when it's sent back and then recooked and tastes like rubber the second time... Well, that's a disgrace.

wm-pR4_K6i7PH3G2CQYH9Q.text: Disregarding the price, The steak is the best I've ever eaten.  We come here every year when we decide to go to UK for vacation, and have sampled all of its cuts.  The special marinade they have here is what brings the Aberdeen Angus, the wine, and their wide array of sides together in harmony.  Definitely recommend if you ever feel like going  to Richmond.The restaurant itself is clean, with an outdoor section for people who decide to do lunch.  The interior is very cute, white leather chairs and black table, perfect with friends, wine and some.

l68-2KJol0vPfzFCfeWZkA.text: Great place and location. If in the mood for a  great steak dish with a nice quiet river view then this is the spot. I've eaten at the other locations in London city and tower bridge however good friends of mine had taken me to dinner at this location and loved it.

yjp1yLCUgVkPiWsJde0B8A.text: Love it here. I come here often, the food is great and they have a good wine list... The river view ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - Richmond, London, United Kingdom. Chicken salad. It's yummy.

V6UbpFiECu6clPPd0798GA.text: Booked a month in advance of returning to the UK after having lived in Richmond in 2010.  An excellent memory from 5 years ago, wanting to do it all again.  They were very accommodating of several changes to our schedule.  Food was delicious, but not worth the pounds.  Dinner for 6 ended at $270/couple.  At that price point there's little flexibility for subpar product.  The churasco was maybe 5% exquisite, 60% very good, 25% mediocre, 10% unenjoyable.  Their frites (both ways) are simplistic - not a delicious country style, just simplistic.  The haricots were so so.  Wine was good to go, although the red was served right out of the cellar - again, a massive failure for this caliber of restaurant (supposedly).  Customer service:  this was a one-off situation, but it highlights a lack of experience and competence.  We were seated for dinner adjacent to a table of 5 gentlemen who'd had lunch and remained drinking for hours.  They were unruly only in voice initially, but as our meal progressed their antics did as well.  The restaurant was vigilant, yet continued to serve them.  The table sent us a bottle of sparkling wine, and the restaurant took that as assurance we had nothing to be concerned about.  The manager never spoke to us, apologized, or made any effort to check in on us.  A waitress apologized after one of the gentlemen fell out of his chair.  The bartenders laughed after another stumbled out onto the porch, spilling his wine all over himself.  As a family we tried to play it all off not to ruin our evening, but we were all disappointed that our expectations for a lovey night out, away from the kiddos, at a purportedly and previously very nice restaurant was tantamount to a night at Chili's.  In a situation like this, you might expect to be comped a portion or all of your meal.  Gaucho made no effort to compensate for the terrible meal.

jb-vm2wD36nrZXhiGf27-g.text: For a more formal or special meal Gaucho is perfect - every time I have been here I have had perfectly cooked steak, amazing sides to accompany and lovely wine to complete the meal. Staff are always friendly and know there stuff! Ask for recommendations and they will always be able to suggest something for you.

WkcU8cYPC9gEMN1hBPSiyA.text: The food was good but didn't live up to the pretentious atmosphere or prices. Shared the gaucho sampler with four friends. The filet was the best cut but none were truly impressive. A co-worker had the t-bone which was better. Everyone seemed to enjoy the wine selection.Desserts were good. Scallops were a little over cooked but tastey. Fish cakes also good.

_B35oqfH6HZVXjsn_MQDMw.text: Went here for my birthday dinner last night and it was a complete disappointment.  Apparently having a reservation for 19:00 means you get seated in the bar for 30 minutes before getting a table.  When these kind of prices are charged I expect not to have to send back my Chorizo steak for being over cooked.  My girlfriend's was also overcooked but she was too polite to send it back.  Coming from a culinary family, I know that chefs know how to cook meat, and I would think they would know how to here, especially in a steak house!  When I did get my dish a second time it was under cooked! I did not send it back that time, although I would have, if I wasn't so ready to just leave.  The near rare steak had absolutely no flavor like a good cut should have and for that price. The even more disappointing thing was to hear the table behind me have to send back their steak for not being cooked properly!  I don't know if someone was having a bad night but I will for sure not go back.

eqqNTtWFW_yqwfoYKGb7Mw.text: Overpriced and crap service. When you have greeters taking people's coats at the door and charge outrageous prices for your food you need to step it up and have waiters who know the menu and are personable. This place is nothing more than manufactured pomp in a beautiful setting.The worst part is that the manager came over and told us - not even apologetically - that'd we need to vacate the table because they have another party arriving. When you pony up £500 for dinner you don't expect to be treated like you're in a Wetherspoons.The two stars are for the design and location.

JiY8DAgGrW253t6wi3vAXA.text: me no likey ....no me gusta    :(Now Gaucho Manchester is a 'go to' for me but this prettily situated  Richmond Riverside establishment with all its Black & Chrome, low lit, crowded and extremely noisy dining space is way too pricey and completely outclassed by their Amigo's in the North West.I get what previous reviewers have said and took it as read that I would enjoy going here but nope, never happened. I think it says it all for a spot that specialises in meat when the best dishes we had on the night were all composed of everything but meat...The Humista, Salmon Ceviche and Mozzarella Empanadas ...were good indeed and worthy of 5*...but the Churrasco de Lomo @ £40.95, before you even start to add any sides, was average at best and the tail ends were overcooked to the point that they were actually tough and what really racked me off was the insipid Caipirinha I started the evening with, a sign of things to come as it turned out.Other things that did not appeal...the service was erratic and one of our servers dumped the individually ordered starters in the middle of the table and flounced off as if  she had just smelled a fart?! We spent most of the evening trying to grab the attention of passing waiters and the bloke who originally looked like he was assigned to us spent a large part of his shift fire fighting far too many other tables. They look seriously understaffed.I hope things do pick up here as it's in a beautiful location alongside the river Thames and on  some warm Summer evening the outside patio would probably be worth a visit but I was left with the serious impression of a place that is more aucho! than gaucho ...

SGFVWrFCtfBWNkgWNvJOQw.text: A well-kept secret, Richmond's edition of the popular Gaucho has perched itself just by the waterside, under a massive oak tree (is it an oak tree? My herbology isn't up to scratch). It has lovely seating both indoors and outdoors, with wall-to-wall windows making a glorious change from the usual Gaucho styling (underground, dark, romantic). Possibly the brightest of the Gaucho cousins, I would strongly recommend this one for a romantic dinner this summer, while the weather is good. In the winter, it should also be lovely, but I doubt you'll make it there in time to watch the sun set at that time of year!

ZcZU0_0ZL93YA5aMjwqmgQ.text: great location but dismal food & service. what happened gaucho? you used to be good....many starters not availablewine arrives after main coursesteak not cooked as requested fat on rib eye still chewy & rawno more hand cut chipscheap deep fried chips like old fag ends in a bowlpepper sauce like watered down brown sauce - artificial & sicklyempanadas have so little filling they barely have any flavourfor £50+ quid a head I will make sure there is a michelin star next time

oyc2kGVH4Pjy_mhy5oscPw.text: Beautiful interior and even better food I highly recommend this restaurant to all beef lovers. Although it is rather expensive (I paid around £120 for 2 people starters mains sides and a cocktail each) the quality of the food is worth it. The fillet was absolutely delicious, highly recommend this picturesque branch if you're looking for a good steak!

5K8CkqXkGhKRlONUIVFzow.text: if you are looking for somewhere to have steak, without needing to worry about the price, them this is definitely the place to come. The waiter brings the various cuts of meat to the table and explains what each is, a nice touch. Don't come here if you have children to feed, as there is no child menu, and there are no child friendly dishes on the menu either.I also object to bottled water being brought to the table without asking, and them being charged £4 for it!However, the food is of very good quality, but expensive, with the need for ordering any side dishes required as none are included with the main dishes. The restaurant itself has a modern feel to it, with lovely views over the river.

tzQFEF10tv-hezYf2z7-EQ.text: Excellent place a bit off the main drag. Not far, but I would not have known unless a colleague mentioned to me. Incredible ceviche and a very modern feel.

2TB7vXI4toSrgy_I0YK3Gg.text: Part of a chain of restaurants this one has a really nice setting on the River Thames at Richmond just yards along the towpath from the bridge. Wonderful outside dining area and an ultra modern glass fronted restaurant make this a great place for that special dinner or occasion. Upscale and expensive food coupled with good wines and a cocktail bar will turn that special occasion into to an amazing one. Choose the actual cut of beef that you want and then tell them how you would like it, sit back and relax over a glass of wine or a cocktail and wait for it to arrive. Alternatively they do a bar menu and burgers etc but all this comes at a cost, For me it is for special occasions or when I have money to burn, Therefore I won't choose a burger however good it is. It is all very impressive and I love it, couldn't go there all the time as I ain't got the enough money.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - Richmond, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - Richmond, London, United Kingdom

6R5kAKGiXVpYoj9UAq9Glw.text: Went here for lunch last year and it didn't rock my world completely. The food is really good but the prices are not friendly. It is a place to try if you are a steak lover - but you do need to be ready to pay. The staff are lovely and very attentive- cannot fault the service. Definitely a plae to go for more a special occasion not a friends lunch - unless you have the ££

9j5_ePwymiDJelIeLgIn3g.text: You will struggle to find a better steak in London. This branch of Gaucho Grill is ideally situated by the Thames with glass walls providing an uninterrupted view of the river, and with a lovely outdoor seating area for when the weather permits. This is a fantastically atmospheric place to go for dinner, with a delicious selection of food on offer. It would be a great shame to come here and not order a steak, but they do offer some good alternatives. The staff are very knowledgeable, taking the time to explain the different cuts of beef on offer. There is not one dish on the menu I would not recommend, but my absolute favourite has to be the bife de lomo, a silky soft fillet steak, accompanied by humitas, a wonderful puree of sweetcorn wrapped and roasted in plantain leaf. The wines and cocktails on offer are just as tantalising as the steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - Richmond, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - Richmond, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - Richmond, London, United Kingdom
